00057 #include "stdafx.h"
00058 #include "SBWConfig.h"
00059 #include "SBWRawException.h"
00060 #include "SBWCommunicationException.h"
00061 #include "RuntimeProperties.h"
00062 
00063 #ifdef WIN32
00064 #include <io.h>
00065 #endif
00066 
00067 #ifdef HAVE_SYS_STAT_H
00068 #include <sys/stat.h>
00069 #endif
00070 
00071 #define LINE_BUFFER_SIZE 50
00072 #define MODULE_PORT_FIELD "sbw.module.port="
00073 
00074 
00075 using namespace SystemsBiologyWorkbench;
00076 
00077 std::string RuntimeProperties::getPropertiesFile()
00078 {
00079         std::string dir = Config::getRuntimeFilesDirectory();
00080         std::string file(dir);
00081         file += SBWOS::DirectorySeparator();
00082         file += "run.properties";
00083 
00084         return file ;
00085 }
00086 
00087 int RuntimeProperties::getSBWModulePort()
00088 {
00089         std::string file = getPropertiesFile();
00090 
00091         TRACE("Loading runtime properties from " << file.c_str());
00092             
00093         FILE *fp;
00094         if ((fp = fopen(file.c_str(), "r")) != NULL)
00095         {
00096                 size_t taglength = strlen(MODULE_PORT_FIELD);
00097                 char line[LINE_BUFFER_SIZE];
00098 
00099                 while (! feof(fp) && (fgets(line, LINE_BUFFER_SIZE, fp) != NULL))
00100                     if (strncmp(line, MODULE_PORT_FIELD, taglength) == 0)
00101                     {
00102                         // Why doesn't fscanf work like I expect it to?
00103                         // fscanf(fp, "sbw.module.port=%d", &port)
00104 
00105                         char *newline = strchr(line, '\n');
00106                         size_t end = newline - line;
00107 
00108                         // If the broker isn't running, the value will be empty
00109 
00110                         if ((size_t)(line + taglength) != end)
00111                         {                           
00112                             char buf[10];
00113                             strncpy(buf, line + taglength, end - taglength);
00114                             fclose(fp);
00115                             return atoi(buf);
00116                         }
00117                         else
00118                         {
00119                             TRACE("Value of sbw.module.port is empty");
00120                             fclose(fp);
00121                             return -1;
00122                         }
00123                     }
00124 
00125                 fclose(fp);
00126                 TRACE("Unable to read sbw.module.port from runtime file");
00127                 return -1;
00128         }
00129         else
00130             TRACE("Unable to open " << file.c_str());
00131 
00132         TRACE("Cannot load sbw.module.port");
00133         return -1;
00134 }
